alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 6:20AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Butler, central Choctaw, northeastern Monroe, northern Clarke and Wilcox Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 620 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Magnolia to Gilbertown. Movement was east at 120 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thomasville, Camden, Pine Hill, Vredenburgh, Yellow Bluff, Toxey and Pine Apple. TIME...MOT...LOC 1120Z 271DEG 103KT 3214 8760 3189 8831 MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
